description.p: Gods of the Hearth are the patrons of all those who offer shelter to others. Followers of these gods are selfless individuals that put the comfort of their companions before all else. They seek to provide shelter to the weak, and bolster their allies. Hearth Clerics see themselves as the first line of defense against those that seek to destroy the warm, safe places of the world.

A host has certain obligations to their guests. You should be able to provide warm food, rest, respite, and safety. When you select this Divine Domain at 1st level you gain proficiency with the Herbalism Kit, Cook’s Utensils, and Heavy Armor.

When you choose this Divine Domain at 1st level your warm presence during respites allows your companions to rest as if they were in their own bed. During a short rest you may touch one friendly creature and end one condition, disease, poison, or remove one level of exhaustion from them.
In addition, you learn the Create Bonfire cantrip, which counts as a Cleric cantrip for you, but doesn’t count against the number of cantrips you know.

sheet.description: During a short rest you may touch one friendly creature and end one condition, disease, poison, or remove one level of exhaustion from them.

description.p: You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Hearth Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

Starting at 2nd level, you gain this additional channel Divinity option. As an action, you may cast Leomund’s tiny hut, without expending a spell slot or material components. Any creature that spends hit die while inside the hut may roll the die twice and keep the higher of the two rolls.

sheet.description: You may cast leomund’s tiny hut, without expending a spell slot or material components. Any creature that spends hit die while inside the hut may roll the die twice and keep the higher of the two rolls.

description.p: At 6th level, when you use an action or bonus action to stabilize an ally or cause an ally to regain hit points, you are under the effects of the Dodge action until the beginning of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you use an action or bonus action to stabilize an ally or cause an ally to regain hit points, you are under the effects of the Dodge action until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: Beginning at 8th level, you learn to channel the warmth of the Hearth into your weapon’s strikes. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to do an extra {{divine-strike:damage-dice}}d8 fire damage to the target.

description.p: Starting at 17th level a number of friendly creatures, equal to your Cleric level, that complete a short or long rest with you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: They are cured of any poisons or disease.
Their level of exhaustion is reduced by two.
They regain maximum hit points from their hit die rolls.
They gain temporary hit points equal to your Cleric level.

sheet.description: Up to {{level:cleric}} creatures that complete a short or long rest with you gain the following benefits: They are cured of any poisons or disease. Their level of exhaustion is reduced by two. They regain maximum hit points from their hit die rolls. They gain {{level:cleric}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Whether bound together by friendship, blood, faith; love runs throughout the most powerful bonds. The gods of Love deepen such bonds and delight in their strength. Some gods of Love delight in fleeting romance, primal passionate urges, and innocent infatuations. What type of Love, or misguided version of Love, does your god represent?

Clerics of Love preside over marriages and other familial bonding customs, but they also nurture the emotional bonds of friendship and camaraderie. Their divine blessings bolster allies in battle and twist the emotions of their foes.

When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the friends cantrip if you don’t already know it. Additionally, when you use the friends cantrip on a creature they do not become hostile towards you if they were friendly to you before you cast the spell.

sheet.description: When you use the friends cantrip on a creature they do not become hostile towards you if they were friendly to you before you cast the spell.

description.p: You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Love Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

Starting at 1st level, you can forge an empowering bond between allies. As an action, you can choose two willing creatures, including yourself, you can see within 30 ft. and create a magical bond between them. While the bonded partners are within 30 ft. of each other, they can add 1d4 to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. They can each only add this 1d4 once per turn. The bond lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.
Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again. You can also expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to use this feature again.

sheet.description: you can choose two willing creatures, including yourself, you can see within 30 ft. and create a magical bond between them. While the bonded partners are within 30 ft. of each other, they can add 1d4 to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. They can each only add this 1d4 once per turn. The bond lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again. You can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to use this feature again.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to overwhelm a creature with a flash of intense admiration for you, driving them to rash action in your defense.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and choose one creature you can see within 30 ft. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is charmed by you until the start of your next turn, and it must immediately use its reaction to make a weapon attack against a target you designate. If there are no valid targets, it uses its reaction to admire you.

sheet.description: You choose one creature you can see within 30 ft. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is charmed by you until the start of your next turn, and it must immediately use its reaction to make a weapon attack against a target you designate. If there are no valid targets, it uses its reaction to admire you.

description.p: At 6th level, the bond you forge between people shields them from harm. While the creatures under your Emboldening Bond feature are within 30 ft. of each other, they can use their reaction to protect one another. As a reaction when their bonded partner takes damage, they can grant them resistance to all damage for the duration of the attacking creature’s current turn.

sheet.description: While the creatures under your Emboldening Bond feature are within 30 ft. of each other, they can use their reaction to protect one another. As a reaction when their bonded partner takes damage, they can grant them resistance to all damage for the duration of the attacking creature’s current turn.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add +{{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: At 17th level, the bonds you create endure across vast distances. Creatures affected by your Emboldening Bond and gain its benefits while they are both on the same plane.

When a creature chosen for your Emboldening Bond is reduced to 0 hit points, their bonded partner gains the following benefits for 1 minute, or until their bonded partner regains at least 1 hit point. They have advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and they gain resistance to all damage. They can use their action to touch their bonded partner and roll any number of Hit Dice. Their bonded partner regains hit points equal to the total rolled.

sheet.description: Creatures affected by your Emboldening Bond and gain its benefits while they are both on the same plane. When a creature chosen for your Emboldening Bond is reduced to 0 hit points, their bonded partner gains the following benefits for 1 minute, or until their bonded partner regains at least 1 hit point. They have advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and they gain resistance to all damage. They can use their action to touch their bonded partner and roll any number of Hit Dice. Their bonded partner regains hit points equal to the total rolled.

description.p: The gods of luck are patrons of those who embrace chance. All those who leave their lives in the hands of fate all garner favor from such gods. Clerics that belong to this domain barely resemble clerics at all, and their holy symbols are often pieces of gaming sets or lucky charms. When you embrace the ways of the luck domain, gambling with your life brings you great joy, and as a representative of the forces of chance you encourage rash decisions and actions everywhere you go.

At 1st level, you learn that life is a game of chance; sometimes you win, and sometimes you need to improvise. When you select this domain you gain proficiency with one gaming set of your choice and with improvised weapons.

Additionally, if you spend at least one minute observing a game you are not familiar with you can add your proficiency bonus to rolls related to that game. You can only be proficient in one game at a time this way.

sheet.description: If you spend at least one minute observing a game you are not familiar with you can add your proficiency bonus to rolls related to that game. You can only be proficient in one game at a time this way.

description.p: You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Luck Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

When you choose this Domain at 1st level, your luck begins to rub off on those you touch. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a friendly creature, they have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a friendly creature, they have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you gain this Channel Divinity option. As a reaction, when a friendly creature within 30 ft. of you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use this Channel Divinity to give them advantage on the roll.

sheet.description: When a friendly creature within 30 ft. of you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use this Channel Divinity to give them advantage on the roll.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your god blesses your attacks with a strange luck. Your weapon attacks and spell attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 7 or 20, but rolls of 13 and 1 are both considered critical failures. Good luck!

sheet.description: Your weapon attacks and spell attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 7 or 20, but rolls of 13 and 1 are both considered critical failures.

description.p: At 8th level, you may use Wisdom modifier for attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons, and improvised weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances. Additionally, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the weapons type to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: You may use Wisdom modifier for attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons, and improvised weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances. Additionally, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra {{divine-strike:damage-dice}}d8 damage of the weapon’s type to the target.

description.p: At 17th level, you can push your luck to its absolute limits. Once per long rest you can use your action to roll on the Arcane Roulette table. Roll twice on the table below, and choose which of the two results takes effect. The 9th level spell of your choice immediately takes effect as if cast as a Cleric spell by you. You may choose the target of the spell after you choose which of the results you will use.

sheet.description: You can roll on the Arcane Roulette table. Roll twice on the table below, and choose which of the two results takes effect. The 9th level spell of your choice immediately takes effect as if cast as a Cleric spell by you. You may choose the target of the spell after you choose which of the results you will use.

description.p: Clerics that worship gods of Poverty take vows of poverty and peace. They elect to give up all rights to material possessions beyond basic necessities. Usually only armed with a quarterstaff, a simple robe, and one day’s worth of rations, they spread divine peace throughout the land. They are bound by divine law to place the needs of others before themselves, and to use violence only as a last resort.

Gods of the Poverty Domain are few, as most gods prefer to have multitudes of followers and ornate temples. But gods of Poverty value quality of worship over quantity, and seek peace above all else. While their followers are few, they are among the most devout.

As a devout follower of the way of peace your god blesses you with a special measure of protection against bodily harm. At 1st level when not wearing any armor, using a shield, and wielding only a simple weapon your armor class is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: When not wearing any armor, using a shield, and wielding only a simple weapon your base armor class is equal to {{ac:armor of peace}}.

description.p: Also at 1st level, you are blessed with the skills to see into the hearts of men, so that you may avoid bloodshed at all costs. You gain proficiency in the Insight skill. When you make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine a creature’s motivations you may add double your proficiency bonus.

sheet.description: When you make a Insight check to determine a creature’s motivations you may add double your proficiency bonus.

description.p: You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Poverty Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

At 2nd level you gain the following Channel Divinity option. When a creature within 30 ft. of you takes damage you can use this Channel Divinity to magically take the damage yourself. As a reaction you gain resistance to all damage and take the damage from the attack as if you had been the target. Once you take the damage, any resistances you gained from this ability immediately end.

sheet.description: When a creature within 30 ft. of you takes damage you can use this Channel Divinity to magically take the damage yourself. As a reaction you gain resistance to all damage and take the damage from the attack as if you had been the target. Once you take the damage, any resistances you gained from this ability immediately end.

description.p: By 6th level, your dedication to Poverty has pleased your god and you are rewarded with the supernatural ability to spare creatures in combat. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage (like a quarterstaff) you can choose to impose a special condition instead of killing them.

Instead of falling unconscious the creature is charmed for 1 minute. During that time, the charmed creature is docile, refusing to do anything unless you command it to. You can’t order the creature to attack, force someone to make a saving throw, or cause damage to itself or others. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or if you or your companions attack the creature, deal damage to it, or force it to make a saving throw. When the effect ends, the creature falls unconscious if it still has 0 hit points.
Once you use this ability you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage you can choose to impose a special condition instead of killing them. Instead of falling unconscious the creature is charmed for 1 minute.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you learn to channel your god’s chastisements into your weapon strikes. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 magical bludgeoning damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can cause the attack to do an extra {{divine-strike:damage-dice}}d8 magical bludgeoning damage to the target.

description.p: At 17th level, your dedication to an impoverished lifestyle, living with only the bare necessities and relying on the generosity of others has made you resilient in both body and soul. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Gods of shadow are often worshiped by cults and creatures that live deep underground. Almost entirely evil, their followers and cultists look to sow fear and confusion throughout the world by blotting out light and destroying the hope that comes with it. As a Cleric of shadow, why have you chosen to walk in their darkness?
You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Shadow Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

When you select this Domain at 1st level, you gain the ability to extinguish the light of others. When you deal damage to an enemy creature, any conventional light source they are carrying, or cantrip that produces light, is extinguished.
If the light source is magic in origin, the spellcaster concentrating on the spell producing the light has disadvantage on the Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration.

sheet.description: When you deal damage to an enemy creature, any conventional light source they are carrying, or cantrip that produces light, is extinguished. If the light source is magic in origin, the spellcaster concentrating on the spell producing the light has disadvantage on the Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration.

description.p: Additionally, at 1st level, your god enhances your senses so that you may serve them in the darkness. You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 ft.

sheet.description: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 ft.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you gain this Channel Divinity option. As an action, you hold aloft your holy symbol and force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 ft. of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if they are in darkness.

sheet.description: You force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 ft. of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if they are in darkness.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, being submerged in darkness enhances your connection to your god, granting you enhanced senses. While in darkness, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Wisdom (Perception) checks.

sheet.description: While in darkness, you have advantage on Stealth and Perception checks.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add +{{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: At 17th level, your darkness inspires a deep instinctual fear in your victims. When you cast a spell or use a class feature that imposes the frightened condition on an enemy creature, it instead imposes the paralyzed condition.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell or use a class feature that imposes the frightened condition on an enemy creature, it instead imposes the paralyzed condition.

description.p: What motivates people more than anything? Gold. Clerics of Wealth recognize the great truth, that money makes the world go round. Merchants, bankers, aristocrats, and criminals all worship the gods of gold, and work to advance their god’s agenda while also furthering their own interests.

What motivated you to serve such a master? Were you a merchant who would do anything so make an extra copper? An orphan who had to build themselves up from nothing? Or a noble, your heart filled with greed and a lust for gold?

Your worship of Wealth has granted you a keen insight into commerce. At 1st level you gain proficiency in both Insight and Persuasion. Whenever you make an Insight or Persuasion check related to the value of an item or to broker a transaction you can add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an Insight or Persuasion check related to the value of an item or to broker a transaction you can add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

description.p: You gain Domain Spells at the Cleric levels listed in the Wealth Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how Domain Spells work.

The presence of valuables registers on your senses like heavenly music in your ears. Starting at 1st level you can use an action to open your awareness to detect nearby treasure. For the next minute, you know the location of any valuable objects within 60 ft. of you that are not protected from divination magic. You know the value of any treasure whose presence you sense, but not any other information.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

sheet.description: You can use an action to open your awareness to detect nearby treasure. For the next minute, you know the location of any valuable objects within 60 ft. of you that are not protected from divination magic. You know the value of any treasure whose presence you sense, but not any other information.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you can channel the power of your god to make your wealth easier to transport and trade. As an action, you can evoke this Channel Divinity and touch one non-magical object of size Large or smaller. The object is turned into a precious gemstone, no larger than your fist. The gemstone has the same worth as the object you transformed. As an action you can crush the gemstone and the original object appears in an empty space within 5 ft. of you.

sheet.description: You can touch one non-magical object of size Large or smaller and turn it into a precious gemstone, no larger than your fist. The gemstone has the same worth as the object you transformed. As an action you can crush the gemstone and the original object appears in an empty space within 5 ft. of you.

description.p: At 6th level, your dedication to the growth of your wealth devotion to your god has awarded you with divine benefits. You have advantage on saving throws to resist the charmed and frightened conditions.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist the charmed and frightened conditions.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any Cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add +{{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: At 17th level, your god has granted you access to their divine vault of treasure. When you cast a Cleric spell of 8th-level or lower that consumes a material component with a gold cost, you can choose to ignore the material component as your god allows the cost to be filled from their own coffers.

You may use this ability to substitute the gold cost of material components worth up to 1000 gp. Once you reach that limit you must either supply them yourself or complete a long rest to use this ability again.

sheet.description: When you cast a Cleric spell of 8th-level or lower that consumes a material component with a gold cost, you can choose to ignore the material component as your god allows the cost to be filled from their own coffers. You may use this ability to substitute the gold cost of material components worth up to 1000 gp. Once you reach that limit you must either supply them yourself or complete a long rest to use this ability again.
